    • CloudAudit Definitions
    • Cloudtrail
      • Service Disabled
    • EC2
      • TCP port open
      • Host IP added to Security Group
      • Security group specifies a port range
      • Security group unrestricted traffic
    • ELB
      • Old ELB SSL policy
    • IAM
      • Active user key not rotated
      • Passwords not set to expire
      • Inactive access key not rotated
      • Passwords policy doesn't exist
      • Multiple active access keys
      • MFA not enabled
      • Root MFA not enabled
      • Root user has active password
      • Users can reuse old passwords
      • Active root Access Key
      • Unused or empty IAM group
      • Account using inline policies
    • RDS
      • RDS is Publicly Accessible
      • RDS short backup retention
      • RDS no automatic upgrades
    • Redshift
      • SSL not required
      • No user activity logging
    • S3
      • World open policy all
      • Logging disabled

    Cloudtrail Service is disabled

    CloudTrail logging is not enabled for this region. It should be enabled.
    Edit me

    Details

    AWS CloudTrail is a web service that records AWS API calls for your account and delivers log files to you. The recorded information includes the identity of the API caller, the time of the API call, the source IP address of the API caller, the request parameters, and the response elements returned by the AWS service.

    With CloudTrail, you can get a history of AWS API calls for your account, including API calls made via the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command line tools, and higher-level AWS services (such as AWS CloudFormation). The AWS API call history produced by CloudTrail enables security analysis, resource change tracking, and compliance auditing.
    https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

    Suggested Action

    Enable CloudTrail logs for each active region.
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-create-and-update-a-trail.html
